[http://www.compositesw.com/products-services/monitor/ Composite Monitor] | homepage = [http://www.compositesw.com/ www.compositesw.com] }} '''Composite Software, Inc''' is a privately held [[data virtualization]] software company based [[San Mateo, CA]]. Composite Software was founded in October 2001 by Michael R. Abbott. In 2003, former Active Software founder and webMethods CTO, Jim Green joined Composite Software as CEO.{{cite web|url= http://www.information-management.com/issues/2007_42/10000447-1.html |title=Virtual Reality |author=Ericson, Jim |date=2007-12|accessdate=2011-03-29}} ''Information Management'' Composite Software provides [[Data Virtualization]] solutions to provide instant access to the data business users require, while shielding them from IT's complexity. Composite Software was cited as an industry leader in the [[Forrester Research]] ''"2012 Forrester Wave: Data Virtualization"'' study for its help in advancing data virtualization to its current form, known under a variety of names including data federation and Information as a Service.{{cite web|url=http://www.forrester.com/rb/Research/wave%26trade%3B_information-as-a-service%2C_q1_2010/q/id/55204/t/2 |title=2012 Forrester Wave Report: Data Virtualization|accessdate=2012-01-05}} ''Forrester Research'' ==Composite Data Virtualization Platform== The [http://www.compositesw.com/index.php/products/ Composite Data Virtualization Platform] is [[Data Virtualization]] middleware that "brings together data from multiple, disparate sources -- anywhere across the extended enterprise-- into a unified, logical virtualized data layer for consumption by nearly any front-end business solution including portals, reports, applications and more."{{cite web|url=http://www.infoworld.com/d/architecture/information-service-131 |title=Information as a service|author=Bishop, Tony|date=2008-03-10|accessdate=2010-03-26}} ''InfoWorld'' The [http://www.compositesw.com/index.php/products/ Composite Data Virtualization Platform] consists of: - [http://www.compositesw.com/index.php/products/composite-information-server/ Composite Studio] which includes an [[integrated development environment]] for source data introspection, relationship discovery, [[data modeling]], view and data service development, and [[revision control]]; - [http://www.compositesw.com/index.php/products/composite-information-server/ Composite Information Server] which includes a query engine with patent-pending [[query optimization]] technology, caching, data access, data publishing, [[data quality]], security, [[data governance]] and a metadata repository; - [http://www.compositesw.com/index.php/products/composite-application-data-services/ Composite PerformancePlus Adapters] for Greenplum, Hadoop/Hive, HP Vertica, IBM DB2, IBM Informix, IBM Netezza, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, Oracle MySQL, SAP Sybase, SAP Sybase IQ and Teradata; - [http://www.compositesw.com/products/data-discovery/ Composite Discovery] to locate key entities and reveal hidden data relationships within enterprise data assets; - [http://www.compositesw.com/index.php/products/composite-active-cluster/ Composite Active Cluster] for scalability that maintains continuous availability of data services to fulfill [[service level agreements]]; - [http://www.compositesw.com/index.php/products/composite-monitor/ Composite Monitor] to provide comprehensive coverage in a real-time view for both [[systems management]] and [[data governance]]. ==Customers== Composite Software's [[data virtualization]] software is deployed at eleven of the top twenty money center banks, seven of the top ten pharmaceutical companies, four of the top five integrated energy companies, major communications, consumer and industrial companies, and government agencies including the world's largest IT organization, the U.S. Army.
